result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurt A Gutermuth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Schedule IV Drugs, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(i).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Schedule IV Drugs, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(i).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1: The Court sentences Mr. Gutermuth  to 10   years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  6  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 4  years.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to any sentence in being; otherwise to begin FORTHWITH. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge
--to pay $559 subpoena fees
--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent

--No possession or consumption of illegal drugs or alcohol
--No presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores except as required by employment as authorized by Agent
--No contact with any known drug user or dealer, unless specifically approved by the agent for treatment
purposes
--No Contact with Zachariah Johnson, Elizabeth (Betty) Wilson, or Nicole Henning
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

[ml] Case called at 2:17PM
[All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Kurt A Gutermuth appears, in custody. ADA Jeffery Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This hearing is scheduled for a Sentence Adjustment Review.

The State advises that it does not believe that the Defendant is not eligible for Sentence Adjustment due to Statute.
The Defendant advises that he was mistaken as to this.
The Court dismisses the Defendant's Petition for Sentence Adjustment for reasons stated on the record, and invites the Defendant to file again once he is eligible.

[MA]Case called at 10:09am
Defendant Kurt A Gutermuth in court with Attorney Stephen Richard Kramer.  Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court verifies receipt and review and PSI and letters in support of Defendant

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall; Atty. Kramer
Statement made by Mr. Gutermuth

On Count #1: The Court sentences Mr. Gutermuth  to 10   years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  6  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 4  years.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to any sentence in being; otherwise to begin FORTHWITH. 

On Count #2: The Court sentences Mr. Gutermuth to  2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  1 year.  This sentence is to served concurrent to the sentence in Count #1

On Count #3: The Court sentences Mr. Gutermuth  to  2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1  year.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to the sentence in Counts #1 and #2

On Count #4: The Court sentences Mr. Gutermuth to 2   years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1  year.  This sentence is to be served concurrent to the sentence in Count #3. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

The Court gives  478   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--No possession or consumption of illegal drugs or alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores except as required by employment as authorized by Agent
--No contact with any known drug user or dealer, unless specifically approved by the agent for treatment
purposes
--No Contact with Zachariah Johnson, Elizabeth (Betty) Wilson, or Nicole Henning
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge

from Attorney Kramer withdrawing the request for a Miranda Goodchild Hearing
Court trial on February 15, 2017 at 10:00 am.

[MK] cases #15CF406 and #16CF8 called at 9:53am. 
Defendant Kurt A Gutermuth in court, in custody, with Attorney Stephen R Kramer.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall files an Amended Information, containing all charges on the joined cases, in Case #16CF8.
Service of the Amended Information in Case #16CF8 admitted; reading is waived.
Attorney Kramer reaffirms the pleas of "Not Guilty" on all counts.
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses Case #15CF406.

Attorney Kramer indicates that the Defense is prepared to waive jury trial rights. 
The Court reviews with Mr. Gutermuth the right to a jury trial and the considerations to be given regarding the jury waiver decision.  Thereafter Mr. Gutermuth verifies that it is his decision to waive jury trial rights.  
ADA Hall indicates that the State is waiving jury trial rights.  
The Court accepts both of the parties waivers of jury trial rights.  The case will be tried to the Court. 

Attorney Kramer updates the Court on his own medical concern and Attorney Kramer requests adjournment of the trial dates.  
ADA Hall verifies victim compliance; there is no victim-notification issue related to adjournment.  
Counsel anticipate needing one or two days for the Court Trial. 
The Court grants the trial adjournment request of the Defense. 
recess 10:11am for scheduling to be discussed
reconvene at 10:20am for finalization of the new trial dates
Attorney Kramer requests further time for the Defense to give consideration to whether there will be a Goodchild challenge raised. The Court requires Attorney Kramer to file a letter by eob on 12/15/16 indicating the Defense decision on whether there is need for a Miranda Goodchild Hearing. 
recess 10:23am. 

NEXT:   (1) letter from Attorney Kramer on the possible Goodchild-related challenge is to be submitted by eob on 12/15/16,  (2) two day Court Trial in Case #16CF8 on 2/15/17 at 10:00am and on 2/16/17 at 8:30am --JA, please note on the calendar and on the Notice of Hearing that the clerk will have the courtroom open for trial prep by counsel from 8:30am to 10:00am on Day 1 of the trial

[MK] cases #15CF406 and #16CF8 called at 9:18am. 
Defendant Kurt A Gutermuth in court, in custody, with Attorney Stephen R Kramer.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Kramer indicates that the Defense is withdrawing its opposition to the State's Motion for Joinder and the related State's Other Acts Motion.   
On stipulation of the parties, the Court grants the State's Motion for Joinder of Crime; this renders moot the Other Acts Motion that relates to the charges that are now joined for trial.
After the Court and counsel discuss proceeding to trial on the two case numbers, the Court directs the State to prepare an Amended Information that includes all the counts.  
---------------------------------

Attorney Kramer informs the Court that the Defense is withdrawing its Case #15CF406 Motion to Suppress both evidence and statements.  Attorney Kramer provides information on the bases for the Defense withdrawing this Motion.   
The Court allows the Defense to withdraw the Motion, and the Court finds the subject evidence and statements will be admissible at trial. 
--------------------------------

In regard to the issues raised regarding the statement of Mr. Gutermuth that was taken at the Jail on 8/15/15 by Detective Brown, the Court directs the Defense to be prepared to inform the Court tomorrow whether they intend to pursue the Miranda-Good challenge regarding the statement. 
--------------------------------

Evidence is taken on the Defense Motion to Compel Disclosure of Confidential Informants CI1 and CI2:  
Det. Daniel Courtier- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall 
--cross examination by Attorney Kramer
Lt. Det. Jeffery S. Davis- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney Kramer 
Arguments on the Motion given by counsel.  ADA Hall indicates that the State does not intend to admit the subject text messages, however the State has no objection to the Defense admitting such evidence. 
The Court rules that the recipients of the text messages are mere tipsters; they are not transactional witnesses, so the Defense Motion to have the Court compel the State to release identity-information on CI1 and CI2 is denied.  The Court indicates that if the Defense chooses to present evidence of the texts from Z. Johnson's telephone, the Defense will be allowed to do so.
-----------------------------------

After Attorney Kramer indicates that the Defense is not opposing the 11/11/16 State's Motion to Admit Other Acts, the Court grants this Motion.
During arguments on the State's Other Acts Motions dated 11/28/16,  counsel agree that the Defense may present the entire recording of the subject 11/18/15 interview of Z. Johnson so that the context of the communication during the interview is provided.  Thereafter, on agreement of the parties, the Court grants the Motion:  the State will be allowed to admit this Other Acts evidence.
-------------------------------------  

The Court addresses the State's Motion regarding Expert Testimony.   After brief discussion with counsel, the Court grants the Motion with the clarification that the witness-Medical Examiner Jessica Lelinski may testify about independant conclusions reached based on her review of the autopsy report. The Court will allow the State to present the testimony of toxicologist Sara Schreiber. 
---------------------------------------------
The Court grants the State's 11/11/16 Motion to Impeach the Defendant with three prior convictions. 
The Court informs Mr. Gutermuth of his right to testify and the procedure that will be involved with testifying. The Court informs Mr. Gutermuth of his right not to testify and the instruction the Court will give to the Jury about this right.  The Court informs Mr. Gutermuth of the statutory method for questions that will be posed related to impeachment with prior convictions, if Mr. Gutermuth would chose to testify.
In regard to the State's 11/11/16 Notice of Convictions for State's Witnesses, the Court and counsel discuss that the information that Matthew Richardson is on Probation will be admissible.  As to the other witnesses, the Court finds that each of the convictions set forth in the Notice are relevant and admissible as to each witness.   The Court notes that ADA Hall has clarified that E. Wilson has nine prior convictions.  
-------------------------------------
The Court hears arguments on the Defense Denny-Motion.   The Court will allow the Defense to introduce this evidence with witnesses Z. Johnson and E. WIson, however the Defense is required to provide specific date, time, location, witnesses-fact evidence.  
----------------------------------
Attorney Kramer alerts that Court of three matters: (1) that Attorney Kramer has been giving consideration in the past and now to raising a competency issue; he is not doing so now, but he continues to consider this and has discussed this with Mr. Gutermuth; (2) that the Defense is giving consideration to the possibility of a jury waiver;  (3) that Attorney Kramer is experiencing a medical difficulty that he is hopeful will be resolved in the next few days, but may possibly impact his ability to proceed to trial next week. 
The Court discusses with Attorney Kramer that he is to ensure that Mr. Gutermuth has civilian clothing for the trial.  
The Court reviews with Mr. Gutermuth that tomorrow's Final Scheduling/Status Conference is the final opportunity for any change-in-plea.
recess 10:45am. 

NEXT:  (1) FSSC remains on the calendar for tomorrow at 9:00am,  (2) the Jury Trial remains on the Court's calendar to commence on 12/13/16 at 8:30am.

[MK] cases #15CF406 and #16CF8 called at 10:55am. 
Defendant Kurt A Gutermuth in court, in custody, with Attorney Stephen R Kramer.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Kramer indicates that he has been discussing the cases with ADA Hall; at this point he suggests that the matters be scheduled for trial. 
ADA Hall indicates that she is giving consideration to filing a joinder motion; if she decides to pursue joinder, she will file the motion well before the trial date.
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling the trials in these cases on the same dates and times, and then a decision will be made later on which case will proceed, in the event that joinder is not pursued.
Counsel estimate needing 3 to 4 days for the trial length 
recess 11:01am

Cases 15CF406 & 16CF8 called together at 8:55 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Kurt A Gutermuth in court with Attorney Stephen Richard Kramer. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

BOTH CASES: Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Pleas of "not guilty" entered

On Motion to Modify Bond:
Arguments presented

Court presents basis and grants motion to modify bond and requires a $15,000 cash bond to cover cases 15CF406 & 16CF8, with conditions:
-Defendant shall reside at 855 East Lake St. in Lake Mills, subject to the approval of the people that live there, if he is unable to reside there, Mr. Gutermuth is to report to the Court
-No possession or consumption of illegal drugs
-No possession of drug paraphernalia
-Curfew imposed of 10:00 pm - 5:00 am, seven days a week. Must be in the residence on East Lake Street during those times
-No possession of hypodermic needles unless medically necessary
-Take all prescription drugs as prescribed

Atty Kramer requests the Court schedule matters for STC in a few weeks, will better know where case is heading in that time
Recess: 9:18 am
